messages.title: A record of delivery
messages.content: Secured an extra £20m for local NHS services, improving care for patients. Provided local school children with an additional £23.2m funding per year, helping them fulfil their full potential. Given over 46,000 local people an £800 tax cut by raising the Income Tax threshold.

messages.title: A promise of more
messages.content: Invest £8bn per year in real terms by 2020 to protect and enhance our NHS, including £500m to improve mental healthcare. Fight to secure our children the long-term fairer funding formula they deserve. Raise the tax threshold to £12,500, meaning nobody earning minimum wage pays any Income Tax.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest £8bn per year in real terms by 2020 to protect and enhance our NHS, including £500m to improve mental healthcare.
Fight to secure our children the long-term fairer funding formula they deserve.
Raise the tax threshold to £12,500, meaning nobody earning minimum wage pays any Income Tax.

mentions.candidate: Julian has built a reputation as someone who always puts Cambridge first - he delivers the best outcomes for local people.

leaflet.additionalNotes: Leaflet is vertically oriented and some contents are not fully visible. The date of the election, contact information, political experience, endorsements, and quotes sections cannot be completed with the provided image.
